event.title: The temporary scaffolding
event.description:
The “temporary” scaffolding which has cast the northern conclusion of Brooklyn Bridge Park into shadow for a year and a half has become up for way too long, say Brooklyn officials and DUMBO businesses.

Officials have sent a joint letter on the city asking when the scaffolding will be taken down, and firms have started a petition.

The park erected your scaffolding in March 2018 after debris fell in to the park section directly less than the Manhattan Bridge. Per year earlier, a chunk of debris had fallen to the boulder-climbing area.

It seemed a reasonable idea to hide this section of the particular park until the city’s Department of Transportation and the MTA found a way to protect park-goers, officials stated. But the scaffolding was only designed to be up until the city figured out why pieces were falling from often the bridge, the locomotives running over it, and also something else.

In heavy shade under the framework are DUMBO Boulders (an patio boulder-climbing area), the Main Street dog run along with scenic paths. Some benches are closed to the public.
